results.title: From magic mineral to modern miracle
results.creator_credit: J Lloyd Jones, Gas and Fuel Corporation of Victoria and Herschells Films
results.brief_description: An account of how coal provides us with warmth, light, dyes and perfumes, antiseptics, high explosives and coal gas, a valuable fuel for use in both home and industry.

results.title: From king to congress
results.creator_credit: Billy James Parrott and Guggenheim Productions
results.brief_description: Shows the campaign of Andrew Young, a black man running for the U.S. House of Representatives from Atlanta, Georgia. Young was associated with the late Martin Luther King. Young, and his opponent, a politically moderate white, are shown campaigning and debating issues. Supporters of each and the work involved is illustrated as well as comments by supporters and others.

results.title: From Indonesia to India
results.brief_description: The film starts with a typical day in Indonesia in the fields. It shows how New Zealand is providing assistance in training in agricultural methods and use of machinery. It goes on to Malaysia, Pakistan, Sarawak and India with emphasis on the New Zealand contribution under the Colombo Plan to medical technology, resource management and secondary education.

results.title: From Homo Erectus to neanderthal
results.brief_description: Adapted from an MGM film “The Man hunters”, this film discusses the neanderthal man and Homo Erectus and shows how man’s development has been gradual, covering many evolutionary stages. Suitable for Upper Secondary levels.

results.title: From here to there: map reading
results.brief_description: Uses a fantasy journey by two American schoolboys to show the importance of using maps as a survival skill. Though not teaching map reading skills as such, this film should prove valuable as a basic introduction to the study of maps. Suitable for upper primary, lower and middle secondary levels.

results.title: From here to there
results.brief_description: This film shows an aeroplane trip from Los Angeles to New York. Points out the excitement and the poignancy of partings and greetings and the unique visual experience of flying. Suitable for middle and upper primary levels.

results.title: From here to eternity
results.creator_credit: Fred Zimmerman, Buddy Adler and Columbia
results.brief_description: A searing indictment of military life, where one walks the line or pays the price. In a peacetime army camp in Hawaii, the commander’s wife, Deborah Kerr, and career soldier, Burt Lancaster, risk everything in a love affair that could destroy them. Persecuted by his peers, hard-headed Prewitt (Montgomery Clift) wants to settle down with prostitute Donna Reed, but she yearns for a better life. Prewitt’s only friend, Frank Sinatra, stands up to sadistic guard, Ernest Borgnine, and pays the ultimate price. The film culminates in an explosive climax on December 7, 1941, with the attack on Pearl Harbour. “From Here to Eternity” is a riveting drama, considered one of Hollywood’s greatest achievements. Based on the novel by James Jones.

results.title: From Haiti to Trinidad
results.brief_description: A short travelogue containing documentary footage of various Caribbean Islands - Haiti, Barbados, Martinique, Puerto Rico, Trinidad. Includes shots of labourers interspersed with urban footage, topped off with a dash of sunny beaches. No commentary - English intertitles.

results.title: From Grisek: grade one
results.brief_description: For may years the rubber growers of Grisek, in Johore, Malaya, have been processing their own latex, with the result that it was of poor quality. Now, however, with the assistance of the Rural and Industrial Development Authority, they pool their resources and produce rubber. A modern factory enables first-class sheet rubber to be produced in ideal conditions and at the lowest possible cost. The rubber is then sold in bulk on the Singapore market.

results.title: From Graz to Glenroy
results.creator_credit: ACMI Digital Storytelling, Elfrieda Senycia and Viv Mehes
results.brief_description: This story explores the journey of migration from Austria to Australia for Elfrida and her husband. As they rebuild life in a new country they deal with triumps and disappointments including the humiliation of never having their qualifications recognised in Australia.
